tim.pacman

Class AbstractGameMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • tim.pacman.AbstractGameMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameMode

    public abstract class AbstractGameMode
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameMode
    A basic implementation of a game mode, handles basic user interfacing for displaying the players score, time remaining, and the lead player. These messages can be changed by overriding the appropriate get***Message(). Also handles rendering of ghosts and collisions.
    Author:
    Timothy

      • snapToGrid

        public void snapToGrid(Player pl)
        Snaps the player to the grid, where the grid is player x, y - 2 % 16 == 0 Will move a maximum of 0.1f in each direction. Will not change the direction the player is going.
        Specified by:
        snapToGrid in interface GameMode
        Parameters:
        pl - The player to attach to the grid

      • onPlayerCollideWithGhost

        protected void onPlayerCollideWithGhost(long time,
                            Player pl,
                            int ghostIndex)
        Called when a player collides with a ghost. Implementation kills the ghost and removes 50 points from the players score.
        Parameters:
        time - the game time
        pl - the player
        ghostIndex - the ghosts index.
